did.abstract: This collection documents the Death Row Support Project, a project of the Church of the Brethren, which connects individuals incarcerated on Death Row with pen pals.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed and some of the correspondence contains very personal information on incarcerated individual, family members, and/or the people they victimized or allegedly victimized. Please contact an archivist for more information.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence written to the Death Row Support Project from incarcerated individuals seeking pen pals. The correspondence includes Death Row Support Project administrative updates may also contain supplemental materials such as petitions, news clippings, and religious materials.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The items in this collection were donated by Alex Mar in 2023; by Rachel Gross, director of the Death Row Support Project, in 2024; and by Keith Call, director of the Brethren Historical Library and Archives (BHLA), Church of the Brethren, in 2025. The 2025 accession consolidated a smaller amount of Death Row Support Project Records initially donated to the BHLA with the remainder of the collection.

arrangement.p: The collection is currently unprocessed and is not yet arranged. Individual items may be difficult to find.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1978, the Death Row Support Project is a volunteer project of the Church of the Brethren which connects individuals incarcerated on Death Row with pen pals. Organized by Rachel and Bob Gross with the support of the Church of the Brethren, Rachel Gross subsequently served as the project's director for 45 years before retiring in 2023. A volunteer team continues the work.
